newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan dollar closes firmer on exporters' activity.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan dollar closes firmer on exporters' activity.

text.p: The Taiwan dollar reversed its early downturn to close firmer on Monday as exporters' U.S. dollar sales outweighted importers' U.S. dollar demand, dealers said.
The local unit finished at T$27.538, bouncing back from an intra-day low of T$27.560 against Friday's T$27.549 close. Turnover through dealers was US$217.5 million.
Dealers attributed the Taiwan dollar's early fall to U.S. dollar's recent overseas strength and importers' demand for greenback.
"Exporters' U.S. dollar sales emerged later in the day, pushing the rate to a higher close," said one dealer at a foreign bank.
Dealers expected the local currency to move in a narrow T$27.53-56 range on Tuesday.
